instruction: Explain what Adgor is in the context of the game.
output:
# Adgor

Contents
1
Permagor
1.1
Cosmetics
Adgor
is a stackable boost that is powered by ads, not sold in the shop.
An active Adgor will provide a boost to Item Find, Experience, Capture Rate, Gold Find, and Movement Speed. The boost can stack 5 times to a higher % by watching more videos. The boost has a duration of 4 hours and stacks with existing bonuses and consumable boosts.
The Steam platform does not allow ads. If you are playing on Steam, you won’t be able to power up your Adgor or see the Free Stuff and Dungeon Treasure opportunities. If desired and an option for you, you can use mobile to power up your Adgor and then switch back to Steam or Web to play out the rest of your session.
Permagor
[
]
Permagor
is a shop option that will fully power your Adgor without having to watch ads. To see the options, click on the Adgor button in the main home screen. There are 3 shop options for Permagor: 3-day, 7-day, and 30-day. Permagor adds 50% bonus to Item Find, Experience, Gold Find, Movement Speed and Capture Rate for its full duration.
In addition, you will get the extra perks of a cosmetic bundle and a Golden Nameplate which will appear in:
Chats
Leaderboards
Guild
Friend List
Event Ranks
The Golden Nameplate will only be in effect when you have an active Permagor. The Permagor was introduced with the
06-08-2020 update
.
Cosmetics
[
]
Outfit will stay with you even after your Permagor expires. If you get another Permagor, the cosmetic outfit will be automatically exchanged

Contents
1
How do I access the Armory?
1.1
Armory Slots
1.2
Saving, Renaming and Equipping Outfits
1.3
Equipping a Friend or Guildmate’s Gear Before an Encounter
How do I access the Armory?
[
]
To pull up the Armory menu, tap or click on the ‘Armory’ button when viewing your player profile.
This menu will allow you to save, edit, name, and equip different gear outfits.
Your Armory will unlock once you reach
level 25
.
But you can use your friend's or Guildmate's Armory regardless of your level (see "Equipping a Friend or Guildmate’s Gear Before an Encounter" below)
To go into your Armory, go through the purple door in town
next to the augment NPC. Once you have gear outfits saved in your slots, the Armory mannikins will display them! While inside the Armory, tapping on your mannikin will pull up the menu that allows you to save, edit, name, or equip the gear.
To return to town, tap or click on the stairs at the entrance.
Armory Slots
[
]
The first slot in the Armory can be unlocked for just 1 Gold. By default, the first slot the gear you currently have equipped.
To unlock additional slots,
use the left drop-down list in the Armory menu.
There are 10 total slots to unlock through Gold and Gems. Additionally, the slots become av

instruction: Explain what Augment is in the context of the game.
output:
# Augment

Contents
1
Pump Augment
2
Bone Augment
3
Chip Augment
4
Brain Augment
Augments
provide a small boost to familiars when equipped on that familiar's augment table. There are four types of augments, each of which can be obtained through different means:
Bone
: Xirtanium Skeletal Linings (
)
Brain
: Neurion Stimulators (
)
Chip
: Microprocessing Stabilizing (
)
Pump
: Radial Flow Regulator Pumps (
)
The value of the bonus on an augment increased based on the
Stable
amount of the familiar that the augment is equipped to. Augments have a base stat which is multiplied based upon the amount of stables. The base stat on the augment is multiplied by
1 + stable
. This means if a familiar is stabled 2 times, the value is multiplied by 3. If it is stabled 5 times, the value is multiplied by 6. For example, a fusion (stabled 1 time) and epic pump augment (base stat 0.7) provides
0.7 x 2 = +1.4%
bonus.
Stable bonus
Familiar
Fusion
Max stable
Max multiplier
1
2x
2
3x
3
4x
4
5x
N/A
5
6x
Augments may be inserted into a slot or switched with another augment already in the slot, but unlike
runes
, they can be freely removed once equipped. Augments can also be
melted
, returning a portion of their unique material cost, increasing with rerolls. This can be done by the "destroy" option when viewing an Augment. Depending on the augment there are three different materials which the player could receive:
Regulator
(
) from Pump and Bone augments
Brain Stem
(
) from Brain augments
Micron Chi

Notes
Bit Heroes is, put simply, a turn-based game where you explore dungeons searching for loot and monsters. Much of this game plays out like a single-player experience, but other players can have an impact on your game. In-game friends can join your party when you take on the major dungeons this game has to offer, and the weekly PvP and PvE activities are ranked based on your performance compared to other players.
The information below guides new players through the first stages of the game and provides them with general advice.
Character Creation
After you finish the tutorial you can customize the appearance of your character and pick an in-game name. Once you created a character make sure to link it to a Kongegrate account by clicking the
-icon in the user interface. For more information on linking see
Kongegrate's page
.
NOTE
: inappropriate names are usually changed to something else by the developers.
Tips
Don't bother changing your appearance or name in the early game. The 1000 (
) are best to spend somewhere else.

Notes
During battles, the player collects experience, items, gold, and
familiars
. The chance a player finds a quality item or gains a certain amount of experience is determined by the base rates + bonuses. In total, there are five different bonuses that can be boosted by the player. These bonuses are unrelated to the
mechanics
because they do not affect the performance of a character. The five different boostable bonuses are:
Bonus
Description
Item Find
Increase the chance to find a higher quality item
[
1
]
Gold Find
Increase the amount of gold from battles
Experience
Increase the amount of experience from battles
Movement Speed
Increase the movement speed in dungeons and during battles
Capture Rate
Increase the chance for the
prompt
to appear
[
2
]
Item Find
[
]
Item Find does not affect all items. Items
confirmed to be affected
by item find:
Stat-carrying
Equipment
Fusion schematics
PvP Coins
Enchants
(all rarities except mythic)
Mythic Crafting
Materials
[
3
]
Items
confirmed to be
not
affected
by item find:
Pet
Eggs/Accessory Boxes from the
Shop
Cosmetics
(separate loot table, unique drops)
Fusion Crafting materials
(e.g mini syrum, robot sprockets, wet brainz, etc.)
Legendary material
drops
Dungeon chest contents
Note:
The mythic material "
Collar
" is affected by PvP Item Find, making Thursday the best day to farm them.

instruction: Explain what Builds is in the context of the game.
output:
# Builds

Basic Builds:
[
]
There are seven basic builds in my opinion, and they serve as a foundation which all builds are constructed from.
TANK: A tank is modelled to take as many hits as possible, entirely focused on defensive bonuses/modifiers and has a stat distribution of 1
/30
/1
(Meat Shield) to 1
/4
/1
(a useful damage dealer, can heal itself reasonably well but less tanky). It takes more work to be a tank, as a tank must have very good defensive procs to be viable.
OFF-TANK: An off-tank is modelled to take hits for the team but also be a valuable damage dealer. Using mostly defensive procs, and sometimes a few offensive ones, an off-tank is much more popular than a tank at higher levels. It has been proven that as a tank, the sheer amount of health from a full tank is not needed, so, similarly to a bait, the spare TS goes into power. Speed is not recommended with this build. An off-tank's stat distribution is almost always the same, being 5/5/1 or 6/5/1
BAIT: A bait is modelled to be a low health tank, able to take 'target weakest' attacks but still able to survive onslaughts of attacks. A bait is the hardest build to achieve, requiring rock solid procs to be effective and must be well-planned, ensuring that its stamina does not fall above the team's DPS or healer. A bait can have offensive procs as well as defensive ones, to maximise the effectiveness of the bait's enormous DPS potential. A Bait can have any stat distribution as long as it's stamina stays the lowe

items are used to alter the player's appearance without affecting their stats. See

/
pet
type. For example, a sword cannot be disguised with a staff cosmetic, but a sword can be disguised with a sword cosmetic.

]

References
The 'Smithy' menu lets players
UPGRADE
equipment,
MELT
equipment for materials,
REFORGE
equipment, and
CRAFT
items.
As of
08/12/20121
, Craft is renamed to Smithy.
Materials
[
]
Main article:
Materials
Materials are used to create, upgrade, and reforge items OR fuse familiars. There are three different types of materials:
Gear material
(material obtained from melting gear)
Crafting material
(material obtained from dungeons as a drop, melting, and events)
Fusion material
(material obtained from dungeons as a drop, and only used f
or fusions)
Upgrade
[
]
Main article:
Smithy/Upgrade
The Upgrade option allows players to upgrade equipment that they already possess. To find out how much upgrading can improve equipment, reference the
Total Stats
and the
Equipment
pages.
Melt
[
]
Main article:
Smithy/Melt
Melting an upgraded item will provide additional materials. Materials obtained in the Melt menu correspond to rarity and tier of the melted item.
Important Note: +1 any Mythic Gear (Mainhand, Offhand, Head, Body, Necklace, or Ring) before salvaging them will provide you more materials once melted
^This does not work for any other rarity in those [6] gear slots mentioned.
As of
08/12/2021
, Exchange was renamed to Melt.
Craft
[
]

Smithy/Craft
Within Bit Heroes, craftin

instruction: Explain what Daily Bonus is in the context of the game.
output:
# Daily Bonus

Contents
1
Daily Bonus
2
Login Gifts
3
Daily Bounties
4
Notes
Each day contains different bonuses that affect gameplay. The player also receives a gift for logging in, as well as 2 new bounties for up to a maximum of 10.
At GMT+0 midnight, the current day's bonuses end, and the new day's bonuses begin. The player will receive the new bounties and the new daily bonus without needing to reload the game, but the player must reload the game to receive the new day's login gift. If an event has ended, the player must reload the game to receive their event rewards and participation trophies.

instruction: Explain what Elements is in the context of the game.
output:
# Elements

Elemental Gear and Familiars were
added to the game
in
Zone 10/Tier 11
. Their effects come in the form of
elemental resist, bonus elemental damage,
and
special effects.
Contents
1
Elemental Types
2
Formulas
3
Situation - A mixed example to rule them all
4
Q&A
5
Notes
At this time the individual elemental relationships are:
matching
to one type of element,
strong
(er)
to one type of element,
weak
to one type of element, and
neutral
to all others.
[
1
]
Matching the type of element is 100% effective, Strong or Neutral is 75% effective, Weak is 0% effective.
The previous generic damage type found in the game is now referred to as
Physical
damage. Any gear that does not specify an element is now a Physical item.  Additionally, any ability that does not specify elemental damage or resistance now deals/resists Physical damage and is neutral to all other elements.
e.g. The previous bonus of Damage Resist (DR) is matching against Physical damage (100% effective) and is Neutral (75% effective) to all other elements damage.
Elemental Types
[
]
Fire > Earth > Air > Electric > Water (> Fire)
An element is "matching" to itself.
Fire (F):
weak to Water, stronger to Earth
Earth (E):
weak to Fire, stronger to Air
Air (A):
weak to Earth, stronger to Electric
Electric (Z):
weak to Air, stronger to Water
Water (W):
weak to Electric,stronger to Fire
Physical:
neutral to all other elements.
Example
: Fire is weakest against Water 0%, stronger against Earth 75%, neutral against Air/El

Enchants
are items that provide a small stat boost and bonuses when equipped. Higher tiered enchants have higher base stats.
Enchants can be rerolled for different stats, but cannot be upgraded in rarity or tier. Multiple rerolls on the same enchant will incur increasingly higher costs.
Enchants can be dropped by any enemy in
Zones
,
Raids
,
Trials and Gauntlet
,
World Boss
and some treasure chests. They can also be part of packages purchased in the
Shop
occasionally.

[
]
Enchant reroll costs multiply linear by the number of rerolls performed on the enchant. Tiers do not affect reroll costs. The following table will provide an example of how reroll costs scale. You cannot reroll mythic enchants.

All rarities except, Cosmetic and Generic equipment, can be
upgraded
. With each upgrade the equipment obtains more stats. Upgrade cost depends on the tier and equipment rarity.
Skills
Main article:
Skills
The number of abilities each weapon has is dependent on the weapon's rarity. Common rarity weapons only have 2 skills (including 0SP), and it increases by 1 skill per higher rarity. Legendary, Set weapons have identical skill sets.
Certain sets and mythics feature unique skills.
Accessories
Main article:
Accessories
Accessories are equipment that add secondary stats. Certain stats can only be modified with the use of accessories (see
Stats
). Refer to
Smithy/Upgrade
for accessory upgrade costs and limits.
Most accessories can be purchased at the
Shop
and the
Guild Shop
. Several accessories were distributed exclusively in events, and can't be purchased.
Pets
Main article:
Pets
Pets are equipment that provide a chance to assist the player in combat. Refer to
Smithy#Upgrade
for pet upgrading and melting, and
Frequently_Asked_Questions#Skills
for skill behavior.
In general, there are four different procs:

instruction: Explain what Events is in the context of the game.
output:
# Events

Contents
1
Player versus Player (PvP)
2
Guild versus Guild (GvG)
3
Trials & Gauntlet (TG)
4
Expedition
5
Invasion
6
Leaderboard Rewards
7
Notes
Player versus Player (PvP)
[
]
Main article:
PvP
In player versus player, you form a team of your main character and familiars to take on another player's team. The amount of familiars can change when a new PVP event starts. The enemy player is controlled by the AI. Points are awarded or deducted based on defeating or losing to the enemy team.
Rewards are given out at the end of a PVP event based on the number of accumulated points a player has won, as well as the relative ranking of the player.
Guild versus Guild (GvG)
[
]
Main article:
GvG
Guild vs Guild
(
GvG
) is a group event where the player and the player's guildmates compete against other guilds. Battles are formed of guildmates who are scaled to the player's power level. Enemies are scaled to the total stats of the enemy player selected as the opponent.
Each GvG fight has multiple waves of enemies, formed using the selected opponent's guildmates. Party sizes and the number of waves vary per event.
Trials & Gauntlet (TG)
[
]
Main article:
TG
T/G
stands for Trials and Gauntlet. In order to play Trials or Gauntlet, the Player must use tokens (
). The amount of tokens varies based on the difficulty of the trial. The more tokens used, the greater the reward shall be. A maximum of 10 tokens can be held at a given time with a regeneration rate of 1 Token every 45 minutes.

# Familiar

Familiars
(a.k.a. fams)
[
1
]
are monsters (including boss monsters) that can be caught by players in all
zone dungeons
and
raids
.
[
2
]
All normal / base-level / unfused familiars (on this page) are part of the
materials
required to make at least one
familiar-fusion
.
Every time a monster is defeated while questing, there is a small chance for a prompt to appear allowing the player to persuade or bribe the monster into becoming their familiar:
Persuade
: Spend
gold
for a 10% to 40% success chance to catch the familiar.
Bribe
: Spend
gems
for a 100% guaranteed familiar catch.
Contents
1
Capture rate
2
Common Familiars
3
Rare Familiars
4
Epic Familiars
5
Legendary Familiars
6
Dialogue
7
Notes
Familiars scale on percentages of the player's total stats
: Common rarity familiars have 60% of a player's stats, rares have 70%, epics have 80%, and legendaries have 90%.
Stables
: A familiar gains 2% of the player's total stats per upgrade (up to a maximum of 10%) in the stables. The extra stats are distributed proportionally among the familiar's stats.
Elements
: Familiars can be
elemental
, meaning that they have different bonuses and/or resists.
Capture rate
[
]
The
capture rate
determines how often the prompt appears to persuade or bribe (=100% success). The base capture rate can be modified with
boosts
,
daily bonuses
,  and
runes
.
(The
persuade chance
in chart below cannot be modified.)

Capture Rate
Persuade Chance
Persuade Cost
Bribe Cost

instruction: Explain what FAQ is in the context of the game.
output:
# FAQ

Contents
1
General
2
World Chat
3
Gameplay
4
Bonuses
5
Notes
This is the wiki-hosted FAQ for Bit Heroes. If you can't find the answer you need, or if you find an error, please leave a comment below. If you have questions for the developers, post them on the
official discord
or
official forum
.
General
[
]
Bit Heroes World Chat Terms of Service (ToS)
To learn more about ToS, click on the link here :
Terms of service
.
What does RNG mean?
Random Number Generator
. It refers to anything that is
random
in the game.
Ex : loots, box pulls,
familiar
persuasion, map and mobs generation,
autofighting AI
, damages and procs,
fishing
, etc
RNG calculations on Bit Heroes are
server-side
which means the player's client has to "ask" the server anytime something random happens. It makes it way harder or impossible for hackers to manipulate RNG. It is also the main reason why your game freezes when you have connectivity issues.
People often misleadingly think they found a pattern in RNG. They think they have a better or worse luck :
At a certain time of the day
When there are more or less people online
depending on past RNG events like failing to capture a familiar 20 times in a row
When they wear their favorite MrBeast T-shirt
Pray to RNGesus or Lootcifer
Predicting RNG is like predicting a coin toss in a tornado.
World Chat
[
]
Are there commands for in the world chat?
If you type
/help
or
/h
into a chat window, it will give you a list of commands.
The four commands are:
/help
- Thi

Fishing
is a feature added in the

. To
unlock
the fishing little town access you must complete the
Bit Valley
zone. After that it will authorize you to take the boat for travelling to the fishing area.
First Time Fishing Shop Dialogue
[
]
Grella:
Awrite Brammer! Welcome tae th' Fishing Shop! Hae ye seen mah handsome Ishy. Ah miss heem sae much! He hasn't bin haem in yaers!!
Player:
...
Grella:
If ye see heem teel heem ah miss heem sae much. Ah want tae kiss Ishy's wee cheeks.
How to Enter the Fishing Area
[
]
Travel to the fishing area by taking the boat or clicking the FISHING Icon:
Boat
- click on the boat at the end of the dock (bottom right) in town next to Ishmael.
[
1
]
FISHING Icon
- click, then choose 'PLAY' or 'ENTER'.
How to Play
[
]
Stand at the edge of the water, then click the ripples on the water, and then click
START
to begin:
When the sliding fishing bar reaches the maximum distance click the
CAST
button.
Second, press
CATCH
when the sliding fish reaches the moving green bar.
[
2
]
The catch probability depends on what part of the bar you hit (Success rate: green 100%, yellow 75%, orange 50%, red 25%, outside the bar 0%).

Bit Valley
zone. After that it will authorize you to take the boat for travelling to the fishing area.
First Time Fishing Shop Dialogue
[
]
Grella:
Awrite Brammer! Welcome tae th' Fishing Shop! Hae ye seen mah handsome Ishy. Ah miss heem sae much! He hasn't bin haem in yaers!!
Player:
...
Grella:
If ye see heem teel heem ah miss heem sae much. Ah want tae kiss Ishy's wee cheeks.
How to Enter the Fishing Area
[
]
Travel to the fishing area by taking the boat or clicking the FISHING Icon:
Boat
- click on the boat at the end of the dock (bottom right) in town next to Ishmael.
[
1
]
FISHING Icon
- click, then choose 'PLAY' or 'ENTER'.
How to Play
[
]
Stand at the edge of the water, then click the ripples on the water, and then click
START
to begin:
When the sliding fishing bar reaches the maximum distance click the
CAST
button.
Second, press
CATCH
when the sliding fish reaches the moving green bar.
[
2
]
The catch probability depends on what part of the bar you hit (Success rate: green 100%, yellow 75%, orange 50%, red 25%, outside the bar 0%).

# Frequently Asked Questions

Contents
1
General
2
World Chat
3
Gameplay

Bonuses

Notes
This is the wiki-hosted FAQ for Bit Heroes. If you can't find the answer you need, or if you find an error, please leave a comment below. If you have questions for the developers, post them on the
official discord
or
official forum
.
General
[
]
Bit Heroes World Chat Terms of Service (ToS)
To learn more about ToS, click on the link here :
Terms of service
.
What does RNG mean?
Random Number Generator
. It refers to anything that is
random
in the game.
Ex : loots, box pulls,
familiar
persuasion, map and mobs generation,
autofighting AI
, damages and procs,
fishing
, etc
RNG calculations on Bit Heroes are
server-side
which means the player's client has to "ask" the server anytime something random happens. It makes it way harder or impossible for hackers to manipulate RNG. It is also the main reason why your game freezes when you have connectivity issues.
People often misleadingly think they found a pattern in RNG. They think they have a better or worse luck :
At a certain time of the day
When there are more or less people online
depending on past RNG events like failing to capture a familiar 20 times in a row
When they wear their favorite MrBeast T-shirt
Pray to RNGesus or Lootcifer
Predicting RNG is like predicting a coin toss in a tornado.
World Chat
[
]
Are there commands for in the world chat?
If you type
/help
or
/h
into a chat window, it will give you a list of commands.
The four co

instruction: Explain what Glossary is in the context of the game.
output:
# Glossary

The
Glossary
is a list of common terms, slang, and abbreviations used in Bit Heroes & Bit Heroes chat related to the game.
(Please keep this listing factual and rated '
PG
'... this is not the Urban dictionary.)
If you'd like to see a term added here please edit the page
OR
leave a comment below
[
1
]
, or add a note down below.
Abbreviation
Expansion
Description
BH
Bit Heroes
GH
Guild Hall
Used to describe the place where players from the same guild can be all together in one place.
GG
Good game
Short for good game, the acronym GG is commonly used in online gaming at the end of matches as a gesture of good sportsmanship
GZ
Congratz
Congratulations can be abbreviated "Congratz," which is shortened to "Gratz," and finally reduced to "Gz."
P2W
Pay to Win
Used to describe content (or players) that requires spending money
F2P
Free to Play
Used to describe content (or players) that requires
no
spending
RNG
Random Number Generator
‘tool’ used to randomly select a number which is then used
PvP
Player vs Player
Used to describe a battle between two player in one place. You can also choose to fight
with
or
without
your familiars.
PvE
Player vs Environment
Regular content, story mode, or simply non-PvP content.
Leg
Legendary
Rarity (=yellow) of equipment and materials
WB
World Boss
Used to describe a place where players with other online players can fight together against a group of monsters.
T/G or TG
TG
/
Trials
/
Gauntlet
Used to describe the Trials and Gauntlets events.

instruction: Explain what Guild Info is in the context of the game.
output:
# Guild Info

Guilds
are
unlocked
after clearing the Zone 2,
Wintermarsh
.
Guilds are formed of a group of up to 25(+5) players. Your guild members can be added to parties in
Zones
,
Raids
,
GvG
, and
Expedition
. Guild members have access to their own chat and can message each other even if they are not friended.
Guild members may purchase
guild shop
accessories, pets, and consumables based upon the guild's level. Items are unlocked as the guild reaches higher levels.
The guild interface has 4 tabs: Main, Members, Shop, and Events.
Main
shows 4 character initials, level, member #s, message, and buttons: Options, Inventory, Perks, & Hall.
Members
shows current members, rank, and level; arranged by last login, and buttons: Invite, & Contribution.
Shop
shows purchase options and player's current Guild Honor points.
Events
allows access to current and past guild versus guild (GvG) information.
A player must be level 5 or above, and must spend 2500 gold to create a guild. Newly created guilds have no
perks
[
1
]
and are generally discouraged by veteran players.
Contents
1
Guild EXP / Honor
2
Member Rankings
3
Member Permissions
4
Open Guild
5
Notes
Guild EXP / Honor
[
]
Guild EXP is used for leveling the guild. 100% of the player's earned EXP becomes Guild EXP. For example, if the player earns 100 EXP after combat, the player's guild earns 100 Guild EXP.
Honor is used for purchasing items in the
guild shop
. 10% of the player's earned EXP becomes Honor. For example, if the player

]

Honor is used for purchasing items in the
guild shop
. 10% of the player's earned EXP becomes Honor. For example, if the player

Guilds are formed of a group of up to 25(+5) players. Your guild members can be added to parties in
Zones
,
Raids
,
GvG
, and
Expedition
. Guild members have access to their own chat and can message each other even if they are not friended.
Guild members may purchase
guild shop
accessories, pets, and consumables based upon the guild's level. Items are unlocked as the guild reaches higher levels.
The guild interface has 4 tabs: Main, Members, Shop, and Events.
Main
shows 4 character initials, level, member #s, message, and buttons: Options, Inventory, Perks, & Hall.
Members
shows current members, rank, and level; arranged by last login, and buttons: Invite, & Contribution.
Shop
shows purchase options and player's current Guild Honor points.
Events
allows access to current and past guild versus guild (GvG) information.
A player must be level 5 or above, and must spend 2500 gold to create a guild. Newly created guilds have no
perks
[
1
]
and are generally discouraged by veteran players.

Guild vs Guild
(
GvG
) is a group event where the player and the player's guildmates compete against other guilds. Battles are formed of guildmates who are scaled to the player's power level. Enemies are scaled to the total stats of the enemy player selected as the opponent.
Each GvG fight has multiple waves of enemies, formed using the selected opponent's guildmates. Party sizes and the number of waves vary per event.
Like PvP, Guild vs Guild drops coins that are used in
Trade
. The guild is rewarded with Guild Bucks (
) which can be used to upgrade
Guild Perks
In order to play GvG events, the player must use badges (
). A maximum of 10 badges can be held at a given time with a regeneration rate of 1 Badge every 45 minutes. This number can be increased through in game purchases or via guild perks.
Note:
After you start the GvG event you are locked in the guild. You cannot switch to leave your guild until the next reset.

# I want to help edit the wiki

Contents
1
What do I do first?
2
Next Step
3
Discord #wiki-contributors
4
Other Helpful Info
5
Notes
Hello there!
Sounds like you want to help out with maintaining this wiki site or would like to learn how making these pages is done. You were probably searching for something and clicked on this out of curiosity. Or you may have been directed here by one of our editors or pages. In any case you're here now.
What do I do first?
[
]
You can begin editing some pages now if you like but the first best step is to:
Create a user profile.
By creating your own profile you...:
can easily track the edits you have done in the future.
[
1
]
get your own space where you can create a page(s) about you, but more importantly...
get your own space where you can practice edits and formatting.
get your own space where you can create pages before moving them into the 'mainspace' for everyone.
get your own wall/mailbox so people can talk to you.
Next Step
[
]
Find something that you would like to do! See the following for inspiration:
Category:Workit
for a list of tagged pages needing work right now.
Special:Categories
&
Category:"Master list of Categories"
to see how pages are organized.
... um, then begin editing... see this
https://community.wikia.com/wiki/Help:Editing
for help.

]

official
Bit Heroes Discord Server has been created for wiki contributors to work together, take requests, and get information or a

is a gameplay mode where players fight endless waves

of enemies to obtain equipment

[

Home
Frequently Asked Questions

Juppiomenz is the studio that developed and operated Bit Heroes.

their website
,
Facebook
,
Twitter
,
Instagram
, and
Tumblr
.
For support inquiries for Bit Heroes go
here.
Accounts in-game
[
]
In-game Name
Description
Juppiomenz
Account shared by the developers
Mokilok
"Mokilok is the programmer for our company. He is responsible for writing all the fancy code in the game well as keeping the game running smoothly."
Seanfac3
"Seanfac3 is the artist of Juppiomenz. He was the mind behind all the cool creatures, backgrounds, armor and more."
Leesha
"Leesha is the social media manager and is in charge of lots of misc things. She's the third and final member of our team and is responsible for setting up websites, social media accounts, helping with art and design, managing chat moderators, business paperwork, and many other things."

What are Kreds and how do I get them?
[
1
]
[
]
What are Kreds?
[
]
Kreds
are virtual coins that can be spent on cool stuff in Kongregate games.
Once your account is funded, you’ll be able to instantly purchase power ups and virtual items within many of our games found [
here
].
While games on
Kongregate
will always be free for anyone to enjoy,
Kreds
enable players to purchase bonuses that would not otherwise be available or that would take longer to acquire. It’s just another way we enable people to have fun while game developers earn their livings.
Kreds
also support the site, it's features, and the developers that make and upload their games to
Kongregate
.
How can I get Kreds?
[
]
You can load up your account with
Kreds
right now by clicking [
here
]. Image → [
here
]
You’ll also be given the chance to buy
Kreds
whenever you add a virtual item to your cart that you don’t have the funds to cover. Image → [
here
]
Kongregate
offers certain promotions or challenges that offer free
Kreds
. Not all accounts qualify for all offers. Image → [
here
]
How much do Kreds cost?
[
]
$5 USD = 50 Kreds
$10 USD = 100 Kreds + 10 Bonus Kreds
$20 USD = 200 Kreds + 25 Bonus Kreds
$50 USD = 500 Kreds + 65 Bonus Kreds
$100 USD = 1000 Kreds + 150 Bonus Kreds
$250 USD = 2500 Kreds + 400 Bonus Kreds
↑
Source:
https://kong.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/203947539-

Primary stats

Power, Stamina, and Agility are the player's base stats.

Power

Stamina
(

local p = {}

local loader = require('Module:Loader')
local getArgs = require('Module:Arguments').getArgs

local string, table, yesno = loader.require('String', 'Table', 'Yesno')
local currencyData, bazaarData = loader.loadData('Currency/Data', 'Bazaar/Data')

local formatNum, shorten, toNumber = string._formatNum, string._formatShortNum, string._toNumber

local lang = mw.language.getContentLanguage()
-- Template:Currency access point
--
--
function p.currency(frame)
	local args = getArgs(frame)
	
	local s = tostring(args[1])
	if s and s:match('') then return s end
	s = s and s:gsub('%s*([Ss]ky[Bb]lock)?',
)
local m = args[2]
	local useShort = yesno(args['short'] or args['s'] , false)
	local useApproximate = yesno(args['approximate'] or args['approx'] or args['a'], false)
	local useImage = yesno(args['image'] or args['i'] or args['si'] or args['show_image'], false)
	local noLink = yesno(args['nolink'] or args['nl'], false)
	local imageInFront = yesno(args['image_in_front'] or args['iif'], false)
	local alt = args['alt']
	
	return p._currencyTemplate(s, m, useShort, useApproximate, useImage, noLink, imageInFront, alt)
end
function p._currencyTemplate(s, m, useShort, useApproximate, useImage, noLink, imageInFront, alt)

# ModuleCurrency

--
local p = {}

local loader = require('Module:Loader')
local getArgs = require('Module:Arguments').getArgs

local string, table, yesno = loader.require('String', 'Table', 'Yesno')
local currencyData, bazaarData = loader.loadData('Currency/Data', 'Bazaar/Data')

local formatNum, shorten, toNumber = string._formatNum, string._formatShortNum, string._toNumber

local lang = mw.language.getContentLanguage()
-- Template:Currency access point
--
--
function p.currency(frame)
	local args = getArgs(frame)
	
	local s = tostring(args[1])
	if s and s:match('') then return s end
	s = s and s:gsub('%s*([Ss]ky[Bb]lock)?',
)
local m = args[2]
	local useShort = yesno(args['short'] or args['s'] , false)
	local useApproximate = yesno(args['approximate'] or args['approx'] or args['a'], false)
	local useImage = yesno(args['image'] or args['i'] or args['si'] or args['show_image'], false)
	local noLink = yesno(args['nolink'] or args['nl'], false)
	local imageInFront = yesno(args['image_in_front'] or args['iif'], false)
	local alt = args['alt']
	
	return p._currencyTemplate(s, m, useShort, useApproximate, useImage, noLink, imageInFront, alt)
end
function p._currencyTemplate(s, m, useShort, useApproximate, useImage, noLink, imageInFront, alt)
	local curr
	if s:find('[Gg]ems?') then
		s = s:gsub('[Gg]ems?',
)
curr = 'gems'
	elseif s:find('[Bb]its?') then
		s = s:gsub('[Bb]its?',
)
curr = 'bits'
	elseif s:find('[Pp]elts?') then
		s = s:gsub('[Pp]elts?',
)
curr = 'pelts'
	elseif s:fi

instruction: Explain what Official Discord Rules is in the context of the game.
output:
# Official Discord Rules

Contents
1
Official Discord rules of Bit Heroes
2
Bit Heroes Quest In-Game TOS Breach Policy
PROHIBITED ACTIVITIES IN GAME:
Disruption:
Official Discord rules of Bit Heroes
[
]
BE RESPECTFUL
Any form of harassment, threatening behavior, or discrimination is considered 100% unacceptable, including mocking new members. Use of this server constitutes an agreement to abide by the rules and regulations found here and throughout. Breakage of any rules will result in punishment as decided by our Moderation Team.
KEEP IT PG-13+
All channels in this Discord are moderated at a PG-13+ rating level, allowing for profanity. This means that material is inappropriate for children under 13 and you should expect to run into an atmosphere that is adult in nature. We never allow hate speech, highly sexual content or terminology, slurs of any kind, gore/intense violence, drug references (marijuana is allowed), or anything else that is strictly for an adult audience. Excessive profanity is never allowed and is defined by our Moderation Team. Profanity should never be directed at another individual.
NO DRAMA
Any continuous drama will be met with a swift warning and if it continues, will result in removal from the server for all involved parties. Use your block button if you need to.
DON’T SPAM OR SHILL
No shilling, self-promotion, spam, creeping, or soliciting goods/services. No mass DM-ing of members and conversations shouldn’t be excessively repetitive. Self promotion i

instruction: Explain what Pets is in the context of the game.
output:
# Pets

Contents
1
Reforge
2
Guild Shop
3
Offensive
4
Defensive
5
Craftable
6
Event
Pets
are
unlocked
when you have enough gems (
) to buy them at the Shop sales.
Pets are equipment that provides a chance to assist the player in combat. Most pets can be purchased at the
Shop
and the
Guild Shop
. Several pets were distributed exclusively in events, and can't be purchased. There are offensive and defensive pets.
See the
Upgrade
page for information on upgrading and
Melt
for the melt rates. For more information on the trigger mechanics see the
Mechanics
page.
As of
30 April 2020
, players are able to
craft
mythic pets.
Reforge
[
]
Legendary, Set, and Mythic pets are by default a combination of all the three possible
trigger types
(When you get hit, When you hit, and Per turn).
By reforging a pet the player is able change
from three proc types into a singular proc while doubling the trigger percentage
.
Note
: A pet has to be upgraded
once
before it can be reforged via the Craft menu.
All
Set, and Mythic pets can be reforged
for a small amount of epic material (
). The following legendary pets can be reforged:
Beto Ben
Bia
Cenzy
Crintie
Dumglim
Ge
Halleygator
Hurricane Cow
Jellbi
Kiwi
Kota
Litsune
Manila
Meal of the Beetle
Nemrod
Nuro
Piefive
Prisby
Pyr
Raptor Fosil Egg
Rhoe
Ringo
Roogamenz
Sardines
Shelly
Tako
Thymos
Toebert
Tsunami Crab
Urgoff
For example, an Urgoff (+1) with three procs has 30.75% chance. With reforge the Urgoff can be changed to have a "When you get hit" proc

blanking
, or inserting gibberish into pages.

instruction: Explain what PVP is in the context of the game.
output:
# PvP

Home
Zones
•
PvP
•
Raids
•
Trials & Gauntlet
•
Invasion
•
World Boss
•
Expedition
•
Fishing
•
Guilds
•
Daily Bonus
In player versus player, you form a team of your main character and familiars to take on another player's team. The amount of familiars can change when a new PVP event starts. The enemy player is controlled by the AI. Points are awarded or deducted based on defeating or losing to the enemy team.
Rewards are given out at the end of a PVP event based on the number of accumulated points a player has won, as well as the relative ranking of the player.
The number of points won or lost is based on the total stats (TS) of the enemy. If enemy TS is lower than 400 then the points are 40+TS/5; if enemy TS is higher than 2200 then points are capped at 300; if enemy TS is between 400 and 1800 then the points are TS/10+80. Points are always rounded to the lowest integer (so 150.9 points are 150 points).
Excel formulas that calculate the above are (can be used interchangeably):
FLOOR(40 + MIN((Enemy_TS/5), 80) + MIN((MAX((Enemy_TS - 400),0) / 10), 180),1)
IF(Enemy_TS<400,40+Enemy_TS/5,IF(Enemy_TS>2200,300,FLOOR(Enemy_TS/10,1)+80))
As of
23/3/2018
, losing a battle in PvP will gain a fraction of the winning points instead of losing points.

. When raiding, the player must form a team of him or herself and 4 others with the option to choose familiars, friends, and/or those in the player's guild. The team of 5 must navigate through a dungeon fighting pairs of difficult enemies before reaching and defeating the final raid boss.
In order to go raiding, the player must use
shards

). Raids require the use of one raid shard per run. Shards regenerate at a rate of one shard every two hours. The maximum limit is 4 shards, which can be increased by upgrading your
guild perks
(maximum 9 shards for max guild perk level).

instruction: Explain what Runes is in the context of the game.
output:
# Runes

Contents
1
Rune Fragments
2
Minor Runes
3
Major Runes
4
Meta Runes
5
Relic Runes
6
Artifact Runes
Runes
provide a boost to the player when activated in their rune table. In total, there are 5 different types of runes:
Minor (
)
Major (
)
Meta (
)
Relic (
)
Artifact (
)
Runes may be permanently inserted into a slot, but may not be moved to another slot once placed. The player may have multiple runes in the same slot of their rune table, but only one rune may be active at any time. Runes only effect the player that has them equipped.
Runes are not 'dropped', but may be obtained through crafting or as prizes in events such as PvP and Trials. Runes are crafted using Rune Fragments (
), Gold, and other materials. Crafting will provide a random rune of the type being created for all runes below Myth status.
Inserted runes can be destroyed for materials by using the 'Melt' button. Only inactive runes can be melted. When melted, runes return 20% of their rune fragment crafting cost.
For example, a legendary Minor/Major rune will return 100 rune fragments when melted.
Rune Fragments
[
]
Rune fragments
are materials used to create runes. See
Smithy
for more details.
Rune fragments are obtained from some
PvP
,
Fishing
and
Trials/Gauntlet
event rewards, as a
login gift
, as a reward from
daily bounties
, watching an ad chest in dungeon, purchasing from the
Fishing Shop
and from melting runes.
Minor Runes
[
]
Minor runes (
) provide the player with
bonuses
. There are 4 different

instruction: Explain what Settings is in the context of the game.
output:
# Settings

Once you log into your character, you are able to enter your settings. The symbol is a mechanical gear and the location is between the
world chat
icon (message bubble) and the friends icon. Below is a list of the settings and a short explanation:
Windowed
[
1
]
: Sets the game to windowed mode. Unchecking this sets the game to fullscreen mode.
Disable auto pilot on death
: Automatically turns auto off if any teammate (including yourself) dies in-combat.
Ignore boss
: Ignores the boss in the
dungeon
/
raid
if you are playing on auto.
Ignore shrines
: Ignore HP and SP shrines if you are playing on auto.
Show golden nameplate
: hide/unhide the golden nameplate which indicates an active
Permagor
.
Show helm
: hide/unhide helmet. If you hide your helmet, other players can see you without your helmet.
Show mount
: hide/unhide
mount
. If you hide your mount, other players can see you without your mount.
Notifications
: hide/unhide notifications. You get a notification whenever:
Anyone gets a
legendary
,
set
,
mythic
, or
ancient
equipment for the first time
Anyone gets a
legendary
or
mythic
familiar/
schem
atic
for the first time
Anyone
upgrades
a
set
,
mythic
, or
ancient
equipment to the next tier
Someone on your friends list logs in
Someone on your friends list gets an
epic equipment
/
familiar
/
schematic
for the first time
App notifications
: When you have maximum energy or something has occurred, you will be sent a notification of sorts (can be disabled).
Friend re

output:
# Skills

Contents
1
Set
2
Mythic
3
Ancient
4
Mainhand
5
Notes
A player obtains skills by using a mainhand. In total, there are seven different mainhand types:
Sword
Axe
Spear
Staff
Bow/Crossbow
Laser Canon
Fists
[
1
]
Every mainhand with common, rare, epic, or legendary type have the same skills. The number of abilities depends on the rarity. Common rarity mainhands only have 2 skills (including 0SP), and it increases by 1 skill per higher rarity. Set, mythic, and ancient rarities have unique skills.
Common = 2 skills
Rare = 3 skills
Epic = 4 skills
Legendary/Set/Mythic/Ancient = 5 skills
As of
22-10-2020
, all skills have a chance to
ricochet
.
Set
[
]
Main article:
Skills/Set
MARU
and
Unity
are the only sets that give a special skill when equipped correctly. Other sets contain a mainhand piece with special skills.

Total Stats
and the
Equipment
pages.
Melt
[
]
Main article:
Smithy/Melt
Melting an upgraded item will provide additional materials. Materials obtained in the Melt menu correspond to rarity and tier of the melted item.
Important Note: +1 any Mythic Gear (Mainhand, Offhand, Head, Body, Necklace, or Ring) before salvaging them will provide you more materials once melted

08/12/2021
, Exchange was renamed to Melt.

output:
# Stable

Contents
1
Familiars
2
Fusions
3
Calculation
3.1
BooBoo example
4
Notes
The
Stable
is a building in which
familiars
and
fusion-familiars
are kept. A player can board familiars to increase its stats and
augment value
. A familiar gains 2% of the player's total stats per upgrade (up to a maximum of 10%) in the Stable. The extra stats are distributed proportionally among the familiar's stats. Once a player boards a familiar it can no longer be used for battles. Familiars can always be released from the Stable to use them again, however, you lose the bonus you gained from having them in the Stable until you board them again.
For example, if you have 2 Shrampz and stable 1. The remaining Shrampz's stats increases +2%, augment value increases +1, and can be used in battle.
Familiars
[
]
Familiars
scale on percentages of the player's total stats (
Power +
Stamina +
Agility).

instruction: Explain what Stats is in the context of the game.
output:
# Stats

Contents
1
General
2
World Chat
3
Gameplay
4
Bonuses
5
Notes
This is the wiki-hosted FAQ for Bit Heroes. If you can't find the answer you need, or if you find an error, please leave a comment below. If you have questions for the developers, post them on the
official discord
or
official forum
.
General
[
]
Bit Heroes World Chat Terms of Service (ToS)
To learn more about ToS, click on the link here :
Terms of service
.
What does RNG mean?
Random Number Generator
. It refers to anything that is
random
in the game.
Ex : loots, box pulls,
familiar
persuasion, map and mobs generation,
autofighting AI
, damages and procs,
fishing
, etc
RNG calculations on Bit Heroes are
server-side
which means the player's client has to "ask" the server anytime something random happens. It makes it way harder or impossible for hackers to manipulate RNG. It is also the main reason why your game freezes when you have connectivity issues.
People often misleadingly think they found a pattern in RNG. They think they have a better or worse luck :
At a certain time of the day
When there are more or less people online
depending on past RNG events like failing to capture a familiar 20 times in a row
When they wear their favorite MrBeast T-shirt
Pray to RNGesus or Lootcifer
Predicting RNG is like predicting a coin toss in a tornado.
World Chat
[
]
Are there commands for in the world chat?
If you type
/help
or
/h
into a chat window, it will give you a list of commands.
The four commands are:
/help
- T

output:
# Steam Tips and Tricks - Fast Login

How to embed your Username and Password into Steam Shortcut on Windows Desktop
Right click on your desktop Steam shortcut file then click properties
Add to Target
:  -login [SteamUsername] [Steampassword]
Example
: -login MelvinLover ThisIsABadPassword1
Click Apply Ok.

instruction: Explain what Steam Tips and Tricks - Multiple Accounts is in the context of the game.
output:
# Steam Tips and Tricks - Multiple Accounts

Steam can be found at
Steam
Steps to run multiple accounts on Steam on the same computer and have them reference different characters.
Add new windows user.  Hit [Windows Key] -> Add User.  Note: this account will be deleted later, so don't worry about making a live account if you can make a local account.
Log out of your PC
Log into the PC under the new clean Windows user account.
Download Steam (even if you already have it on your main Windows Account that you started from)
Create new steam account.
Download BitHeroes
Start BitHeroes.
Welcome Hero! Complete the first dungeon.
When possible Click the big Red K on the bottom right of the screen, this will launch Edge and open to Kongregate.com
Log into Kongregate.com with your Kongregate user account tied to your character.
On the open page: Link to Steam.
When complete:  Log out and back in (may take 2-3 attempts and clicking on K again).   You will get a screen that will allow you to choose either the new level 1-4 character you just created or the character who is tied to the Kongregate account.
Click the character you want to use.
Log out and back in.
Once completed and you have verified that the account is appropriately tied, log out of new windows account that you just created.
Go back to the main Windows account
Open Steam
Enter the new Username and Password in steam.
Verify that the account you just created was logged into steam.
Delete the new windows account, do not use t

output:
# Trials

Home
Zones
•
PvP
•
Raids
•
Trials & Gauntlet
•
Invasion
•
World Boss
•

•
Fishing
•

•
Daily Bonus
Contents
1
Trials
1.1
Dialogue
2
Possible Drops
3
Notes
Trials
[
]
In Trials, you and two familiars may challenge a level filled with enemies. Prior to battle, you must select a difficulty level. The higher the tier, the greater the rewards. Players cannot catch familiars or obtain fusion schematics in Trials.
Trial levels are unlocked with dungeon stars, or by clearing the highest Trial level available. Since players can be carried in dungeons by stronger friends, players are recommended to play the levels that correspond to the tier/zone they are in. For example, Tier 1 represents the first zone, Bit Valley.
Crafting materials
[
1
]
can drop from Gauntlet and Trial bosses and mini-bosses.
Hyper Shards
can drop in Tier 5,
Doubloons
in Tier 6,
Rom Bits
in Tier 7,
Luminous Stones
in Tier 8, and
Beanstalks
in Tier 9.
Note
: Trial Legendaries only drop from Tier 4 and above (lv30+). Trial
Sets
and
Mythics
only drop in the difficulty ranges that are teal colour-coded.
[
2
]
Check the
Equipment
page for details on which legendary/set/mythic drop in which tier.
Dialogue
[
]
Unlock
Nyxn: So mortal, you've proven yourself strong enough for my trials. Enter and prove your worth.
Possible Drops
[
]
Note:
Different from Raids and World Boss, Trial & Gauntlet do not guaranteed to have rare or better equipment (i.e. you may get all commons).
Common equipments
Rare e

[

]
How to get the most Xeals for your resources?
: Don't convert energy (
) to Xeals (
). Instead convert energy (
) to Shards (
). Raid gives more Experience as a Word Boss battle. 10% of your experience turns into Guild Honor (
). In the

you can buy Xeal bags. This way you get the most out of your resources.

fusion materials

Item Find Bonus
Normal

Heroic
+50%
Party creation
[
]
The room creator can make the room private, kick players who have joined, and reorder the party. Players must all click the Ready button before the creator can start the battle, but the party does not have to be full. You can have a team for a maximum of 5 members for Orlag Clan, or maximum of 3 members for Netherworld.
Room creators can send party invites to any player currently online, using the search function {Other} [/v][space][username], and/or from their Friend/Guild list.
Tiers
[
]
